titles.title: Girls Protection Act of 2011
A bill to amend title 18, United States Code, to provide penalties for transporting minors in foreign commerce for the purposes of female genital mutilation.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 11/29/2011--Introduced. Girls Protection Act of 2011 - Amends the federal criminal code to impose a fine, up to a five-year prison term, or both for knowingly transporting a girl under the age of 18 from the United States and its territories in foreign commerce for purposes of female genital mutilation.
